section.section: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection or as otherwise specifically provided by statute, a person eighteen years of age or more is an adult for all purposes whatsoever and has the same legal capacity, rights, powers, privileges, duties, liabilities, and responsibilities as prior to July 1, 1973, persons had at twenty-one years of age, and the "age of majority" is hereby declared to be eighteen years.
The terms "adult", "of full age", or "of legal age" refer to persons who have attained the age of eighteen years.
Except as provided in subsection (a)(2) of this section, the term "minor", as it pertains to legal age and capacity, refers to persons who have not attained the age of eighteen years.
